perturbation.original_text: 2.8  User Relations.  Boxlot shall be responsible for providing all customer support regarding the Service or the Co-Branded Pages, and theglobe may redirect to Boxlot any associated customer support inquiries.  Boxlot shall have sole control over the user agreement that governs the Service, and Boxlot shall have the sole responsibility for dealing with breaches of such user agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.8  User Relations. theglobe shall be responsible for providing all level 1 customer support (basic queries) regarding the Service or the Co-Branded Pages, and Boxlot shall handle all escalated level 2 issues, also theglobe may redirect to Boxlot any associated level 2 customer support inquiries.  Boxlot shall have shared control with theglobe over the user agreement that governs the Service, and Boxlot and theglobe shall have the shared responsibility for dealing with breaches of such user agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity by defining different level of customer support responsibilities for each party rather than explicitly assigning customer support responsibilities solely to Boxlot. Further, the responsibility of the user agreement is now shared, conflicting with the original text.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1  Content.  Boxlot hereby grants to theglobe a non-exclusive, worldwide license to use, reproduce, create derivative works of (only as necessary to build pages in a manner consistent with this Agreement), publicly display, publicly perform and digitally perform Boxlot Banners, and those elements of the Boxlot Content served from theglobe's servers (as denoted in Exhibit A), on theglobe Site or otherwise as reasonably appropriate to advertise and promote the Service and the Co-Branded Pages.  Subject to the approval process in Section 2, theglobe hereby grants to Boxlot a non-exclusive, worldwide license to use, reproduce, create derivative works of (only as necessary to build Co- Branded Pages), publicly display, publicly perform and digitally perform the Page Templates on Co-Branded Pages.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1  Content.  Boxlot hereby grants to theglobe a non-exclusive, worldwide license to use, reproduce, create derivative works of (only as necessary to build pages in a manner consistent with this Agreement), publicly display, publicly perform and digitally perform Boxlot Banners, and those elements of the Boxlot Content served from theglobe's servers (as denoted in Exhibit A), on theglobe Site limited to only promoting Auctions. Subject to the approval process in Section 2, theglobe hereby grants to Boxlot a non-exclusive license to use theglobeâ€™s pre-approved Page Templates on Co-Branded Pages. Use, reproduction, creation of derivative works, public display, public performance and digitally performing the Page Templates are not permitted.
perturbation.explanation: The first change restricts theglobe's use of Boxlot content to only promoting Auctions, while the original allows for more general advertising. The second change completely restricts Boxlot from using Page Templates for the purposes stated in the original text.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1  Rights/Restrictions.  Except as specified in this section, each party may freely use and disclose any information (both individual and aggregated) about Users ("User Data").  Neither party shall disclose any User Data in any manner that permits the User Data to be associated with the other party or permits the targeting of Users on the basis of their status as Users (in theglobe's case) or theglobe users (in Boxlot's case), nor shall a party use the User Data to target Users on the basis of their status as Users (in theglobe's case) or theglobe users (in Boxlot's case).  However, either party may disclose User Data if it is aggregated (in a non-associatable way) with data from multiple online properties.  Each party shall use and disclose User Data only in accordance with the privacy policy under which it was collected.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1  Rights/Restrictions.  Except as specified in this section, Boxlot may freely use and disclose any information (both individual and aggregated) about Users ("User Data"). theglobe is not permitted to use or disclose any information (both individual and aggregated) about Users ("User Data").  Neither party shall disclose any User Data in any manner that permits the User Data to be associated with the other party or permits the targeting of Users on the basis of their status as Users (in theglobe's case) or theglobe users (in Boxlot's case), nor shall a party use the User Data to target Users on the basis of their status as Users (in theglobe's case) or theglobe users (in Boxlot's case).  However, either party may disclose User Data if it is aggregated (in a non-associatable way) with data from multiple online properties.  Each party shall use and disclose User Data only in accordance with the privacy policy under which it was collected.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that Boxlot can freely use user data but theglobe can not. The second sentence restricts both parties from disclosing data that permits the targeting of users. This means that Boxlot can technically use the user data but can't disclose the data which creates ambiguity.
